resources.title: Resource Center
resources.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our proteomics services

items.question: How do I place an order?
items.answer: Contact us at omixai@omixai.com with details about your project. We'll provide a customized quote and sample submission instructions.

items.question: What is the typical turnaround time?
items.answer: Standard proteomics analysis takes 2-4 weeks from sample receipt. Rush services are available upon request.

items.question: What payment methods do you accept?
items.answer: We accept bank transfers, purchase orders from academic institutions, and major credit cards for qualifying orders.

items.question: What sample types do you accept?
items.answer: We accept cells, tissues, biofluids (plasma, serum, CSF), and protein lysates. Contact us for specific sample type requirements.

items.question: How much sample material do I need?
items.answer: For tissue: 10-20mg, cells: 1-5 million, plasma/serum: 10-50Î¼L. Lower amounts may be possible - please inquire.

items.question: How should I ship my samples?
items.answer: Ship frozen samples on dry ice via overnight courier. We'll provide detailed shipping instructions and materials upon order confirmation.

items.question: What are the sample quality requirements?
items.answer: Samples should be flash-frozen and stored at -80Â°C. Avoid freeze-thaw cycles. We can assess sample quality before proceeding with analysis.

items.question: What mass spectrometry platform do you use?
items.answer: We use the Thermo Fisher Orbitrap Astral, providing ultra-high resolution (240,000 FWHM) and sensitivity for deep proteome coverage.

items.question: How many proteins can you identify?
items.answer: We routinely identify 8,000-12,000 proteins in human cell lines and tissues with high confidence (FDR < 1%).

items.question: What quantification methods do you offer?
items.answer: We support label-free quantification (LFQ), TMT/iTRAQ multiplexing, and SILAC approaches depending on your experimental design.

items.question: What bioinformatics analysis is included?
items.answer: Standard analysis includes protein identification, quantification, statistical testing, GO enrichment, and pathway analysis. Advanced AI-powered analysis is available.
